page.title: 04Local History (1)
page.content: This area does not boast any monuments or buildings of outstanding historical importance. The church is noteworthy and so is the collection of houses around the mill which bridges the {River Pang.}The small village green acts as a focal point, through which a road now passes on its way up to the steep slopes of the{Downs}to the north. The village nestling in the shadow of the scarp slope has a distinct, tranquil{'old worldly'}air about it and is only encountered by chance motorists deviating from the main Reading to Newbury road. The oldest house in the village lies next to the green and is a two-storey house of thirteenth century age, which still contains the original beams.
